Before the new freeze cast ui, the CastSinkButton (HoverButton) would

automatically set its accessible text to be the title + subtitle, which

was informative enough for screen readers. With the new ui, we should

explicitly set a more helpful accessible name for the buttons within

entry.title: [StartTablet] Fix bug about NTP thumbnail with the visibility of Single Tab Card
entry.content:
This CL resolves an issue related to the NTP thumbnail. Previously, after closing the tab to track in the grid tab switcher, the NTP thumbnail would remain unchanged no matter how many times navigating between the NTP and the grid tab switcher. Therefore, there is a noticeable transition of the single tab card disappearing every time we navigate to the NTP from the grid tab switcher. The problem is demonstrated in the following video: https://drive.google.com/file/d/15acBOOBaYa6O4rrK9wu8PWV3uBG53kQ-/view?usp=sharing&resourcekey=0-FSrKXxNU2bhdMwaS_iTscw



This CL introduces a capture of the NTP thumbnail process. This process is triggered when the single tab card disappears in the NTP and the user navigates back to the grid tab switcher. Therefore, the noticeable transition of the single tab card disappearing will only happen the first time when we navigate back to the NTP from the grid tab switcher.



Bug: 1451915

Change-Id: If1e7f47c01df61aa3237a4564e029c97b80322d0

entry.title: Enable libc++ hardening for NaCl.
entry.content:
Some parts of Chrome are built twice: once as part of the regular Chrome

binary, and another time as part of the NaCl IRT. The latter was not

using libc++ hardening; however, since the saigo toolchain is controlled

by the Chrome team, libc++ hardening can be used there as well.



The compiler configs have been refactored to account for this:

- enable_safe_libcxx allows configurability of the libc++ hardening

checks for code that builds against the bundled custom libc++.

- use_safe_libcxx is calculated based off of the value of

enable_safe_libcxx except when buildling using the saigo toolchain: in

that case it is unconditionally enabled.



Since use_safe_libcxx is now relevant even when not using a custom

libcxx, the relevant defines have been moved out of the runtime_library

config and into the compiler config.



Finally, to allow the assert failures to be tested, add a new toolchain

that is based off the IRT toolchain but using the regular linker. This

allows the saigo toolchain to build a regular nexe that can be tested in

the same way as other nacl tests.



Bug: 1335422

Change-Id: Ib9109ae02491e7e40fd550328316ad96ab920cd3

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4544053

Reviewed-by: Nico Weber

Commit-Queue: Daniel Cheng

Reviewed-by: Derek Schuff

Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1154984}

entry.title: Fix bug with no daylight/night in ScheduledFeature.
entry.content:
At the heart of the problem: This case caused the

GeolocationController to return a -inf base::Time value for sunset and

sunrise. The scheduling code was set up to handle sunset and sunrise

being equal in this case. But it was NOT expecting an infinite

timestamp. The timestamp arithmetic that the scheduling code does

then lead to a CHECK failure deep in the base::TimeDelta class.



Bug: b:285187343

entry.title: saved_desks: Add auto-launch for admin templates
entry.content:
After login, we will now attempt to automatically launch any admin

templates that have been marked for auto launch. The operation is

initiated from `FullRestoreService`. This is done because whether

auto-launch should happen or not depend on the user's full restore

settings.



The actual auto-launching happens in the `SavedDeskController`. The code

waits until the admin template storage model is ready, and then launches

all templates that are marked for auto-launch.



BUG=b:280465457

entry.title: [Multi-instance] Fix 'Empty window' title in multi-window dialog
entry.content:
It is observed that when a new Chrome window is

created from a dragged link, the multi-window dialog seen on clicking

'Manage windows' in the overflow menu shows this newly created window as

'Empty window'.



The TabModelSelectorTabModelObserver in MultiInstanceManagerApi31 is

currently created after tab state initialization as a fix for

https://crbug.com/1441767; this observer's #didSelectTab implementation is responsible for saving the InstanceInfo for the new window and it is possible that the tab state is not yet initialized to add this observer when a new window is created in this case, which is why the correct tab title is not available.



This CL updates the fix for the original bug by writing the tab count only if the tab state is initialized to avoid redundant writes on startup during tab restoration. The CL also moves the observer creation back to MultiInstanceManager#initialize to reduce the possibility of other potential issues that may arise due to this observer creation happening after tab state initialization.



Bug: 1452234

Change-Id: I46ae725d513089544e6d727b41bf1172d9c9bfd9

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4599231

entry.title: Throw DOMException when attempting to create doc pip window returns null
entry.content:
In PictureInPictureControllerImpl::CreateDocumentPictureInPictureWindow, we reject if our attempt to create a window returns null[1]. However, this can happen without the exception_state having an exception thrown, which breaks a DCHECK in script_promise_resolver.cc[2].



This change ensures that for this case, we still throw a DOMException.



[1]: https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:third_party/blink/renderer/modules/document_picture_in_picture/picture_in_picture_controller_impl.cc;l=388;drc=e7ecb1d080bedd53cf5419f79084361871e89365



[2]: https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:third_party/blink/renderer/bindings/core/v8/script_promise_resolver.cc;l=92;drc=6a1a383ac53d92b67f96acf98675cde109a8d9ad

entry.title: Refactor function signatures in MetricsService
entry.content:
Make FinalizeLog() take "const std::string&" instead of "std::string".

I think the rationale for why it took "std::string" initially was just

so it's clear and easier to reason about the lifetime of the input strings when you post this to a background thread. E.g.:



PostTask(

FROM_HERE,

BindOnce(&FinalizeLog, std::move(input_string), ...)

);



But FinalizeLog() isn't posted on a background thread directly. So,

make FinalizeLog() take "const std::string&" instead. Also, make the

functions that do call FinalizeLog() take in "std::string&&".



Bug: 1428679

Change-Id: Ic77cc4b90e19693ffe2676398a5fc202ff83690c

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4598328

entry.title: Rely primarily on `GetLastCommittedURL` for `source_url` verification.
entry.content:
Even though `RenderFrameHostImpl::GetLastCommittedURL` *can* be

different from the renderer-side URL, we should still primarily rely on

it when verifying `source_url` during enforcement of extension IPCs.

This is needed because `GetLastCommittedURL` always correctly represents

the URL of MHTML subframes (and the `url::Origin::Resolve`-based

verification mishandles such scenario).



Bug: 1449796

entry.title: Remove OT client hints and UA reduction OT for embed requests
entry.content:
In order to enabled the UA Reduction/Deprecation origin trial for embed requests (both first-party and third-party), we introduced two client hints: Sec-CH-UA-Reduced/Sec-CH-UA-Full. We accomplished this by persisting Sec-CH-UA-Reduced/Sec-CH-UA-Full from an embed response headers if a valid Origin Trial token is present.



As we completed the UA reduction origin trials, Sec-CH-UA-Reduced and Sec-CH-UA-Full are no longer be persisted in any context, they should be removed and be simplified. For all future similar origin trials, we prefer to use Persistent Origin Trials.



This CL remove the two origin trial client hints: Sec-CH-UA-Reduced and Sec-CH-UA-Full and simplify the client hints logics when parsing

ACCEPT-CH headers. It also refactors corresponding tests to make the user-agent reduction behavior depending on the UA reduction phases' features.





The following up cls will:

* Remove UA reduction origin trial for service worker

* Remove UA reduction origin trial for all requests



Change-Id: I474122a36ec633d5589e8dfc5f11f31916a40863

Bug: 1258063

entry.title: Ensure current GL context when destroying backings
entry.content:
GLTextureImageBacking requires a current GL context when being

destroyed. When running with a Vulkan GrContext, SharedImageStub isn't

necessarily making a GL context current for most operations. For all

shared image creation and deletion via SharedImageStub, check if usage

includes GLES2 and if so, force making GL context current. For a GL

GrContext this makes no difference but for Vulkan or new graphite path

it should help prevent problems.



Bug: 1443596

entry.title: Modify enabling logic for HPRT lookups to check feature flag and SSB
entry.content:
This CL adds two new methods to hash_realtime_utils:

1. IsHashRealTimeLookupEligibleInSession

2. DetermineHashRealTimeSelection



The first currently just checks the feature flag. The second checks both

the first in addition to !off_the_record, SSB, and not Android for now.

DetermineHashRealTimeSelection is eventually intended to be used to

determine whether to use the HashRealTimeService for Desktop and iOS

or a different implementation for Android.



These two methods are then used in the codebase to enable hash-prefix

real-time lookups under the above constraints. For key fetching, only

the first method is used for determining whether to create the key

service, since a user may change their settings and start needing the

service. For navigation, the second method is used. The new parameter

hash_realtime_selection replaces the previous parameter

hash_real_time_lookup_enabled passed into SafeBrowsingUrlCheckerImpl.



This CL also decouples the kHashRealTimeOverOhttp checks from the new

feature check. It does this by introducing the new feature in addition

to a new feature param for the associated relay URL. Eventually, the

kHashRealTimeOverOhttp feature and its associated feature param will be

deprecated. This is written into the code by it allowing either feature

to enable the lookups depending on whether the check was initiated from

the SafeBrowsingLookupMechanismExperiment or whether it was initiated

from a navigation.



Bug: 1441654

Change-Id: Ie67b7dfc47450cca8b426df0d71248ddf619af80

entry.title: Add crash keys with extension IDs for callers of extension API functions
entry.content:
We've recently had a couple cases of hard-to-debug crashes in extension

API code. When trying to reproduce these crashes, it's helpful to know

which extension is making the API call. While go/crash has information

about which extensions are installed for a particular crash signature,

it's often dominated by common extensions (ad blockers, school tools)

that aren't actually causing the problem.



ExtensionFunction implementations can be asynchronous, so there may be

multiple extensions with API calls in-flight, especially at startup.

However, once Chrome has stabilized the number of in-flight calls is

very small (usually 1).



Record crash keys with the calling extension IDs for up to 3 in-flight

extension API calls.



Bug: b:260248404

Test: added to extensions_unittests

entry.content:
In preparation for further extending CopyOutputNV12() support for

MultiplanarSI, this CL parameterizes the tests of that function on

MultiplanarSI being enabled/disabled. These tests currently all pass

with MultiplanarSI, as we've enabled support for blit requests and

are not yet passing NV12_MULTIPLANE for creation requests in the

test even if MultiplanarSI is enabled. We will do so in the next CL

where we implement support for these codepaths.

entry.title: Revert "Generate stdlib GN rules from the Rust src tree when rolling Rust"
entry.content:
This reverts commit e41c960e5892727412b755b55da8d0ee2c2c4821.



Reason for revert:

Still broken, see second bug.



Original change's description:

> Generate stdlib GN rules from the Rust src tree when rolling Rust

>

> Reland of https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4569316

>

> This avoids the need to:

> 1. Build gnrt locally

> 2. Then download the roll CL

> 3. Copy Rust packages to prod

> 4. gclient sync

> 5. Run `gnrt gen --for-std`

> 6. Reupload the CL

>

> In order to have the Rust roll pass the trybots.

>

> upload_revision.py will, when rolling rust, do the `cargo vendor`

> step in the Rust git checkout to get its dependencies, install

> cargo and rustc in a sysroot, build `gnrt` using cargo, and then

> run `gnrt gen --for-std=third_party/rust_src/src` which regenerates

> the GN rules for the Rust stdlib from the updated version of Rust.

>

> Previously gnrt gen --for-std would generate rules from the Rust

> library found in //third_party/rust-toolchain, but that requires

> Rust to already be rolled, so this now uses the feature of specifying

> the Rust source tree root to --for-std.

>

> Bug: 1401042, 1451335

> Change-Id: Iad9cbeebde624232a538c05c197f78d7d1e3e97f

> Cq-Include-Trybots: luci.chromium.try:android-rust-arm32-rel,android-rust-arm64-rel,android-rust-arm64-dbg,linux-rust-x64-dbg,linux-rust-x64-rel,mac-rust-x64-dbg,win-rust-x64-dbg,win-rust-x64-rel

> Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4595858

> Commit-Queue: danakj

> Reviewed-by: Hans Wennborg

> Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1154411}



Bug: 1401042, 1451335

Change-Id: Ib5270c4cc63d72b8d015cf38aca7aae2da65f3cc

Cq-Include-Trybots: luci.chromium.try:android-rust-arm32-rel,android-rust-arm64-rel,android-rust-arm64-dbg,linux-rust-x64-dbg,linux-rust-x64-rel,mac-rust-x64-dbg,win-rust-x64-dbg,win-rust-x64-rel

entry.title: Rework Graphics.Smoothness.Jank to use V3 signals
entry.content:
For PercentDroppedFrames we upgrading from V1 to V3 with more accurate

signals for the importance of the frames. V3 is now a guardrail metric.



We want to eliminate the old V1 path. However some metrics still use it.

Jank is one such metric. This change updated V3 to perform

the calculation.

entry.title: Remove host_cpu = x86
entry.content:
We have fuzzer bots which build for host_cpu = x86. This is wrong - they

only care about target_cpu = x86, but also had host_cpu = x86 to support

libprotobuf-mutator fuzzers.



Unfortunately host_cpu = x86 is a lie, and we can no longer sustain that

lie now that Rust needs to load procedural macro shared objects into the

host 64-bit compilers.



Fortunately, the reason why we had to specify host_cpu = x86 is now

gone. It was to support a protobuf compiler plugin to switch protobufs

from lite to full runtime so LPM could work, and that plugin is now

gone. So we can remove the assert and remove host_cpu = x86.



Bug: 1451027

entry.title: [Payments] HTTP HEAD request for payment method manifest.
entry.content:
Before this patch, Chrome would download payment method manifests via

HTTP GET, which would check the HTTP headers for a Link

rel="payment-method-manifest" first and then, failing to find it, would

fallback to reading the body of the HTTP response. This HTTP GET had a

1MB file limit.



The HTTP GET was problematic for web developers who used the payment

method identifier URL to host both human-readable content and the API

end-point HTTP Link rel="payment-method-manifest" header. If the

human-readable content grew above 1MB, then Chrome rejected the API

end-point, even though it did not need to download the full

human-readable content.



This patch changes Chrome to download the payment method manifest via

HTTP HEAD request on the payment method identifier URL. If the HTTP

headers do not have a Link rel="payment-method-manifest", then Chrome

will fall back to HTTP GET request on this URL.



After this patch, Chrome is more resilient against changes to

human-readable content that is hosted on the same URL as the payment

method identifier API end-point with HTTP header Link

rel="payment-method-identifier".



Bug: 1450596

Change-Id: I26975138546b35a6c77142ffe1f3f4b64df1d833

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4579537

entry.title: Add SVGElement::SynchronizeAllSVGAttributes() for the "sync all" case
entry.content:
The various implementations of `SynchronizeSVGAttribute()` are basically

only handling the "sync all" case, and the base implementation in

`SVGElement::SynchronizeSVGAttribute()` handles the "single" case by

calling `PropertyFromAttribute()` and then synchronizing the attribute

object that's returned. De-virtualize the "single" case and let a new

`SynchronizeAllSVGAttributes()` handle the "sync all" case. This is

essentially achieved by renaming the existing variant and removing the

checks on the `name` parameter.



Rename the `SynchronizeAllSVGAttributes()` helper to

`SynchronizeListOfSVGAttributes()` to help differentiate between the

different variants. Use the helper in a few more instances.



Change-Id: I739a9005d4484d81c9b6b53c1c7365e960a9442c

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4598007

Reviewed-by: Steinar H Gunderson

entry.title: [//gpu] Eliminate GLES2 command decoders' lazy binding code on Windows
entry.content:
The command decoders' lazy binding is a no-op if the following is true:

- For the validating command decoder, Texture::HasUnboundLevelImage() is

false

- For the passthrough command decoder,

TexturePassthrough::is_bind_pending() is false



Following recent refactorings and simplifications, neither Texture::SetUnboundLevelImage() nor TexturePassthrough::set_bind_pending() is

ever called on Windows, meaning that the decoders' lazy binding is

always a no-op on that platform. This CL eliminates that code from being

built on Windows, leaving Apple as the only remaining platform with lazy

binding (will be tackled once the VTVDA refactoring is complete).



Bug: 1323341

entry.title: [ios] Replace WebStateInsertedAt() with WebStateListChanged()
entry.content:
This CL replaces WebStateInsertedAt() API with WebStateListChanged().



This CL is a part of refactoring WebStateListObserver API:

Step 1: Introduce WebStateListChanged() w/ kReplace type in WebStateListChange and replace WebStateReplacedAt() with it

Step 2 [this CL]: Introduce kInsert type and replace WebStateInsertedAt()

Step 3: Introduce kMove type and replace WebStateMoved()

Step 4: Introduce kDetach and kDestroy type and replace WebStateDetachedAt() and WebStateListDestroyed()

Step 5: Replace Will*() with WillWebStateListChanged()

Step 6: Migrate WebStateActivatedAt() to WebStateListChanged()



No behavior changes.



See https://docs.google.com/document/d/1I1QUZAexM1eMI2l2oriZl5GARrtofNI0SxHUPB4h-YE/edit?usp=sharing for more details (internal document).

entry.title: Revert "[Extensions] Enable tabCapture with workers and offscreen documents"
entry.content:
This reverts commit 3302a41972d9b5a278901a4b745e1df2ad9e7b10.



Reason for revert: OffscreenApiTest.TabCaptureStreams is very flaky on Windows CI, see crbug/1453212.



Original change's description:

> [Extensions] Enable tabCapture with workers and offscreen documents

>

> MediaStreams are unavailable in ServiceWorker contexts. This means

> the tabCapture API doesn't work in Manifest V3 background contexts

> (since these are service worker-based). The primary alternative to

> functionality that's tied to a DOM or Window context is to use

> offscreen documents; however, these (by design) do not have access

> to extension APIs, which means they can't access the tabCapture API.

> This effectively means there's no good way to use the tabCapture

> API in a background context in Manifest V3.

>

> Fix this by:

> - Allowing service worker contexts to use

> `tabCapture.getMediaStreamId()`. This returns an ID that can

> later be used to fetch a media stream, rather than returning the

> MediaStream object itself. As such, it's (conceptually)

> compatible with service worker contexts.

> - Allowing offscreen documents to use the media stream ID to

> start capture via the navigator.getUserMedia() API (which is

> what tabCapture.capture() already used).

>

> In practice, this entails allowing extension contexts to use a

> media stream generated by another context *on the same origin*, rather

> than restricting it to the same frame that created the stream ID.

> (This isn't a change in security or privacy, since the extension could

> already pass any of this information between its own contexts.)

> Additionally, update `tabCapture.getMediaStreamId()`'s implementation

> to not rely on the presence of a RenderFrame.

>

> Add an end-to-end test using offscreen documents to capture the

> stream of an active tab.

>

> Bug: 1400269

> Change-Id: I1e0f0a46d098e56357881ed64dfd249b6b692936

> Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4514180

> Reviewed-by: James Cook

> Reviewed-by: Mark Foltz

> Reviewed-by: Avi Drissman

> Reviewed-by: Elad Alon

> Commit-Queue: Devlin Cronin

> Reviewed-by: Tim

> Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1154676}



Bug: 1400269, 1453212

entry.title: [Android][Autofill] Convert EditorFieldModel into PropertyModel for autofill editors.
entry.content:
EditorFieldModel contains information about editor fields. It supports

text fields and dropdown fields. Corresponding sets of fields are

factored out to EditorProperties.



* FieldProperties now define fields common to every field.

* DropdownFieldProperties are properties specific to dropdown fields.

* TextFieldProperties are properties specific to text fields.



The following editors are refactored to support new field model:

* Autofill AddressEditor.

* Payments legacy AddressEditor.

* Payments ContactEditors.



Corresponding test files are refactored accordingly.

entry.title: [test] Limit Apache KeepAliveTimeout to 10s
entry.content:
Currently, we set KeepAliveTimeout to 9999s. This keeps connections

alive for very long, causing timeouts in tests with many connections

because we run out of worker process/threads. This patch changes

KeepAliveTimeout to 10s.



The Apache documentation (https://httpd.apache.org/docs/2.4/mod/core.html#keepalivetimeout) says: "Setting KeepAliveTimeout to a high value may cause performance problems in heavily loaded servers. The higher the timeout, the more server processes will be kept occupied waiting on connections with idle clients."



In the logs from the bugs below, we indeed see the following message:

"AH00161: server reached MaxRequestWorkers setting, consider raising the MaxRequestWorkers setting". With this patch, the message does not

appear in the logs anymore and the tests stop flaking.



Note that the patch changes some text expectations for network headers

because the KeepAliveTimeout value is a header.





Bug: 1417314

Bug: 1450925

Bug: 1419059

Change-Id: I4e1d460fc9ee6309d710696bcf504cf51ac978d0

entry.title: [win] Add [[nodiscard]] to RegKey methods that conditionally modify `this`
entry.content:
`base::win::RegKey` has a few methods that conditionally change the key

to which the instance refers. Subsequent operations performed after

calling these methods could be dangerous if they were to operate on the

original key (e.g., open a subkey and then delete values in that

subkey). Add `[[nodiscard]]` to these methods to ensure proper use.



Bug: none

Change-Id: Ia692a81fc993d2f1d7c4862d05df2a58018f9380

entry.title: [LCPP] Only instantiate LCPP when the feature is enabled
entry.content:
Before this CL, every `blink::LocalFrame` could lazily instantiate

`blink::LCPCriticalPathPredictor`.

After this CL, `blink::LCPCriticalPathPredictor` is only instantiated in

`blink::LocalFrame::GetLCPP()` call if:

- the frame is main frame, and

- the feature flag is enabled



This CL also moves the feature flag to blink/public/common so we can

access the flag from both `chrome/browser/predictor` and

`third_party/blink`.



Bug: 1419756

entry.title: Trigger Screen AI usage recording and download on browser UI thread.
entry.content:
Recording of Screen AI usage, and triggering download on the first use

should happen on browser UI thread as they need access to local state

and component updater.

While this was ensured before for the usages outside Ash, requests

triggered from Ash violated this and need an extra post to the correct

thread.



As a side change, `ImageAnnotationWorker` is updated to trigger

download if Screen AI DLC is not available, and bind annotator only

when DLC is downloaded.





AX-Relnotes: n/a.

Bug: 1278249

entry.title: Adopt base::NoDestructor for KeyedService factories
entry.content:
For changes under /chrome/browser/sync_file_system



It replaces base::Singleton, following the latest recommendation

in base/ and browser_context_keyed_service_factory.h.



For factories with no logic in the destructor, it makes no difference.



For this particular instance, tests require refactoring to avoid

stateful factories. The new approach leans on SetTestingFactory(),

which is the recommended way to override factory logic.



LSC doc:

https://docs.google.com/document/d/1x1LqRQyfBOmpMkNQBYs7QBPSxLtuiImvmgcJYI_kaS4/edit?usp=sharing



This CL was uploaded by git cl split.

entry.title: DanglingPtr: mark unretained dangling ptr in ChromeDownloadManagerDelegate
entry.content:
Doc:

https://docs.google.com/document/d/1YQCh_mezoSF1fWS9TaMEh0Whumb8eNe0KWV8MBs7sFs



We detected those callbacks are invoked using dangling pointers.

This is something we would like to detect and potentially ban.



In the meantime, we need to annotate them using:

base::UnsafeDanglingUntriaged



Outside of the experiment, it is a no-op.

Within the experiment, it skips DumpWithoutCrashing.
